definition: bachelor's degree/person holding a university degree
member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker
members of the Hanlin Imperial Academy 翰林院, employed as imperial secretaries from the Tang onwards
student of theology/Bachelor of Divinity/Taleban (Farsi: student)

sentences.english: Meg graduated from Taiwan's Ming-Chuan College with a BA degree in Tourism Management.
sentences.chinese: 吳湘玲畢業於臺灣銘傳大學，獲旅遊管理學士學位。

sentences.english: In 1989 he graduated from the Xian Academy of Fine Arts with a degree in oil painting.
sentences.chinese: 1989年畢業於西安美院油畫系，獲得學士學位。

sentences.english: I held the B. A. degree in English from Zhejiang Univerisity.
sentences.chinese: 我取得了浙江大學的英語學士學位。

sentences.english: 1970 b . f . a applied arts seoul national university.
sentences.chinese: 1970年漢城國立大學，實用藝術，美術學士。

sentences.english: Zhoubo, obtained his LLB degree from East China University of Politics and Law , is the senior partner of Shanghai Wintell Law Firm.
sentences.chinese: 華東政法大學法學學士，上海瀛泰律師事務所合夥人。

sentences.english: Jibing Chen got both Bachelor's and Master degree from Beijing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics.
sentences.chinese: 他在清華大學獲得自動化專業學士和碩士學位。

sentences.english: "Well, " said Tyrion, "a maester does not need a cock. "
sentences.chinese: “沒錯，”提利昂說，“學士纔不需要老二呢。”

sentences.english: Later, aristocrats and literary figures helped expand the ceremony to common people.
sentences.chinese: 後來，貴族和文人學士把中秋祭月的傳統推廣到民間。

sentences.english: International students with bachelor degrees are eligible to apply for master programs at NPIC.
sentences.chinese: 外國學生具學士學位者，得申請入學本校碩士班。

sentences.english: I held the B.A. degree in English from Zhejiang Univerisity.
sentences.chinese: 我取得了浙江大學的英語學士學位。

sentences.english: She currently pursues her first year bachelor music degree in Haute Ecole de Musique de Genève.
sentences.chinese: 她現就讀於日內瓦國立高等音樂學院，攻讀學士學位。

sentences.english: If you want to apply for that position a B. E is required.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想申請那個職位得具備工程學專業的學士學位。

sentences.english: I attended high school and college at the University of the Philippines and I graduated with a degree in Accountancy.
sentences.chinese: 我在菲律賓就讀高中及大學，並且得到會計學士學位。

sentences.english: I want to say there are around 60 BFAs
sentences.chinese: 我想說大概有60個美術專業文學學士。

sentences.english: The Freshman Orientation Seminar was held.
sentences.chinese: 舉辦學士班新生輔導說明會。

sentences.english: Sir, I should very much like to be admitted to the B. Sc. course in your college.
sentences.chinese: 主席先生，我非常想被接納爲學士課程，您的大學。

definition: master's degree/person who has a master's degree/learned person
doctoral degree/PhD/same as Doctor of Philosophy 哲學博士學位|哲学博士学位
to enter a school or college/to go to school for the first time as a child
to hold an office or post
to promote to a higher position
sinology/Chinese studies (in foreign schools)/Han Learning, a Qing dynasty movement aiming at a philological appraisal of the Classics
to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]
